name: 25 FPS Festival
description: International festival of experimental film and video in Zagreb, exploring the margins between cinema, visual arts, and new media.
known_for: Cinema-visual arts crossover in the Balkans

name: AFI Docs
description: The American Film Institute's annual documentary festival in the nation's capital, spotlighting films that illuminate the issues of our time.
known_for: Documentary festival in the nation's capital

name: ARKIPEL Jakarta
description: Jakarta international documentary and experimental film festival exploring the boundaries of cinema.
known_for: Southeast Asian experimental documentary platform

name: Alchemy Film and Moving Image Festival
description: Scottish Borders festival celebrating experimental film and artists' moving image in an intimate small-town setting.
known_for: Intimate small-town experimental film gathering

name: Ambulante
description: Itinerant documentary festival traveling across Mexico, co-founded by Gael García Bernal, bringing non-fiction cinema to communities beyond traditional venues.

name: Ann Arbor Film Festival
description: The oldest avant-garde and experimental film festival in North America, running since 1963.
known_for: Oldest avant-garde festival in North America

description: Festival of film, video, and new media art on Canada's west coast, championing non-mainstream and artist-driven work.

name: Berlinale Forum Expanded
description: The Berlinale's platform for film and art in the expanded field, presenting installations, performances, and experimental works at the intersection of cinema and visual arts.

name: Black Star Film Festival
description: Festival centering the work of Black, Brown, and Indigenous filmmakers, including experimental and avant-garde shorts and features.
known_for: Centering BIPOC voices in experimental cinema

name: Bogotá Experimental Film Festival (CineAutopsia)
description: Colombia's experimental film festival celebrating radical and non-narrative cinema.

name: Bucharest International Experimental Film Festival
description: Romania's leading experimental film festival, championing innovative visual language.
known_for: Eastern Europe's experimental cinema beacon

name: CPH:DOX
description: One of the world's largest documentary film festivals, with strong programming in hybrid, essay, and experimental non-fiction.
known_for: World leader in hybrid documentary forms

name: Camden International Film Festival
description: Maine-based documentary festival known for its breathtaking coastal setting and focus on non-fiction storytelling, run by the Points North Institute.
known_for: Coastal Maine documentary gathering

name: Clermont-Ferrand International Short Film Festival
description: The world's largest short film festival, with a dedicated experimental competition known as Lab Competition alongside its international and national programs.
known_for: World's largest short film festival with Lab section

name: Courtisane Festival
description: Ghent-based festival for film, video, and media art that values materiality, process, and radical approaches to image-making.
known_for: Radical materiality and process-based image-making

name: Crossroads (SFMOMA)
description: SFMOMA's annual festival of experimental film and video, curated by the museum's film and media arts department.

name: Curta Cinema — Rio de Janeiro Short Film Festival
description: Brazil's leading short film festival with an experimental section spotlighting Latin American and international avant-garde voices.
known_for: Latin American experimental shorts showcase

name: Curtocircuito International Film Festival
description: Spanish short film festival with a strong experimental program, bridging cinema and contemporary art.
known_for: Short film bridging cinema and contemporary art

name: DMZ International Documentary Film Festival
description: South Korean documentary festival near the DMZ, focusing on peace, communication, and life through non-fiction cinema.
known_for: Documentary festival near the Korean DMZ

name: DOC NYC
description: America's largest documentary festival, screening over 200 films annually in New York City each November.
known_for: America's largest documentary festival

name: DocAviv
description: Israel's premier international documentary film festival, showcasing diverse global perspectives on non-fiction cinema each spring in Tel Aviv.
known_for: Israel's premier documentary festival

name: Doclisboa
description: International documentary and experimental film festival in Lisbon, known for curating risk-taking and hybrid cinema.
known_for: Risk-taking hybrid cinema from Lisbon

name: Docs Against Gravity
description: Poland's largest documentary film festival, screening across multiple cities and championing bold, challenging non-fiction cinema.
known_for: Poland's largest documentary film festival

name: Docudays UA
description: Ukraine's leading international documentary and human rights film festival, championing social justice and freedom of expression through non-fiction cinema.

name: EMAF (European Media Art Festival)
description: One of the most significant forums for international media art, experimental film, and digital culture in Europe.
known_for: Europe's leading media art and digital culture forum

name: EMIFF — Edinburgh Experimental Film Festival
description: Edinburgh's dedicated experimental film festival, showcasing radical, non-narrative, and formally innovative work.
known_for: Dedicated radical non-narrative showcase in Edinburgh

name: EXiS (Experimental Film & Video Festival in Seoul)
description: Seoul's international experimental film and video festival, one of Asia's leading platforms for avant-garde moving image.
known_for: Asia's leading avant-garde moving image platform

name: Edinburgh International Film Festival
description: The world's oldest continually running film festival, with dedicated strands for experimental and artist-moving-image work.
known_for: World's oldest continually running film festival

name: Encounters (South Africa)
description: Africa's premier documentary festival, split between Cape Town and Johannesburg, championing African and international non-fiction storytelling.
known_for: Africa's premier documentary film festival

name: Experiments in Cinema
description: Albuquerque-based festival devoted to experimental, avant-garde, and no-budget cinema.

name: FIDMarseille
description: International cinema festival focused on documentary, fiction, and experimental work that pushes boundaries.
known_for: Boundary-dissolving documentary and fiction hybrids

name: FIPADOC
description: French international documentary festival in Biarritz, combining screenings with a professional market and industry forums for non-fiction creators.

description: Annual festival in Gainesville celebrating experimental film, video art, and expanded cinema practices.

name: FRACTO
description: Berlin-based experimental film encounter dedicated to artist-run film culture and the materiality of cinema.
known_for: Artist-run film culture and materiality

name: Festival du Nouveau Cinéma
description: Montréal festival dedicated to new trends in cinema and new media, with a strong experimental and digital arts component.
known_for: New cinema trends and digital arts convergence

description: Week-long residential seminar dedicated to the art and craft of non-fiction cinema, named after documentary pioneer Robert Flaherty.
known_for: Residential seminar honoring Robert Flaherty's legacy

name: Full Frame Documentary Film Festival
description: Intimate, curated documentary festival in Durham, North Carolina, celebrated for its accessible atmosphere and community engagement.
known_for: Intimate and curated doc fest in Durham

name: Hot Docs
description: North America's largest documentary festival and market, showcasing over 200 films from Canada and around the world each spring.

name: IDFA (International Documentary Film Festival Amsterdam)
description: The world's largest documentary film festival, presenting over 300 documentaries annually and serving as the premier marketplace for non-fiction cinema.
known_for: World's largest documentary film festival

name: Images Festival
description: North America's longest-running festival for experimental and independent moving image culture, spanning film, video, performance, and installation.
known_for: Longest-running moving image festival in North America

name: International Film Festival Rotterdam (IFFR)
description: One of the largest audience-driven film festivals in the world, known for championing independent and experimental cinema.

name: Jihlava International Documentary Film Festival
description: Central Europe's largest documentary film festival with a dedicated section for experimental and essay cinema.
known_for: Central Europe's largest documentary festival

name: Kassel Documentary Film and Video Festival
description: German festival for documentary, experimental, and essay film, adjacent to the Documenta art world.
known_for: Documentary and essay film near Documenta

name: L'Alternativa — Barcelona Independent Film Festival
description: Barcelona's festival for independent and non-commercial cinema, hosted at the CCCB cultural center, with a strong experimental program.

name: Lausanne Underground Film & Music Festival
description: Festival celebrating underground, experimental, and outsider film alongside extreme and avant-garde music.

name: Locarno Film Festival — Pardi di domani
description: Locarno's international short film competition, a launchpad for daring and formally inventive cinema from emerging voices worldwide.

name: Los Angeles Filmforum
description: The oldest screening organization in Los Angeles dedicated exclusively to independent, experimental, and avant-garde cinema.

name: Margaret Mead Film Festival
description: Hosted by the American Museum of Natural History, this festival showcases international documentaries exploring diverse cultures and perspectives.
known_for: Documentary festival at the Museum of Natural History

name: Media City Film Festival
description: Canadian festival celebrating experimental cinema and media art at the border of the U.S. and Canada.
known_for: Cross-border experimental cinema and media art

name: New York Film Festival — Projections
description: NYFF's dedicated sidebar for avant-garde and experimental moving image work.

name: New York Underground Film Festival
description: Festival dedicated to transgressive, underground, and no-budget filmmaking in New York City.
known_for: Transgressive and no-budget underground filmmaking

name: Oberhausen International Short Film Festival
description: One of the oldest and most important short film festivals in the world, with a strong tradition of showcasing experimental and avant-garde work since 1954.

name: Onion City Experimental Film Festival
description: Chicago's premier experimental film festival, presented by Chicago Filmmakers.

name: Paris Festival for Different and Experimental Cinema
description: Long-running Parisian festival organized by Collectif Jeune Cinéma, France's oldest artist-run film cooperative.

name: Punto de Vista
description: International documentary and experimental film festival in Navarra, exploring non-fiction cinema at its most adventurous.

name: S8 Mostra de Cinema Periférico
description: Spanish festival dedicated to peripheral cinema, analog film, and expanded practices rooted in materiality and process.
known_for: Analog film and peripheral cinema practices

name: Sheffield DocFest
description: One of the UK's premier documentary festivals, combining screenings with a major marketplace, pitching forum, and industry events.
known_for: UK's premier documentary festival and marketplace

name: Sundance Film Festival — Documentary
description: Sundance's documentary competitions are among the most prestigious launchpads for non-fiction cinema, premiering award-winning docs annually.

name: Sundance Film Festival — New Frontier
description: Sundance's dedicated section for experimental, immersive, and cross-platform work including VR, XR, AI art, and expanded cinema at the intersection of film, art, and technology.

name: Tampere Film Festival
description: One of the oldest short film festivals in the world (since 1970), with an international competition that embraces experimental forms.
known_for: One of the world's oldest short film festivals

name: Thessaloniki Documentary Festival
description: One of the leading documentary festivals in Southeast Europe, presenting international and Greek documentaries alongside industry events.

name: Toronto International Film Festival — Wavelengths
description: TIFF's programme for avant-garde cinema, named after Michael Snow's landmark 1967 film.

name: True/False Film Fest
description: Beloved mid-Missouri festival blurring the line between documentary and fiction, known for its communal atmosphere and adventurous programming.
known_for: Blurring the line between documentary and fiction

name: VAEFF — Video Art & Experimental Film Festival
description: New York-based festival showcasing video art and experimental film from around the world.
known_for: Bridging video art and experimental cinema

name: Videoex
description: International festival for experimental film and video art in Zurich.
known_for: Swiss hub for video art experimentation

name: Viennale
description: Austria's most important international film event, known for curating adventurous and formally ambitious cinema.

name: Vila do Conde International Short Film Festival
description: Portuguese short film festival with a respected experimental section and strong connections to gallery and museum culture.

name: Visions du Réel
description: Switzerland's leading documentary festival, dedicated to creative approaches to documentary cinema and non-fiction storytelling.

name: WNDX Festival of Moving Image
description: Winnipeg's biennial festival for experimental film and moving image art, highlighting artist-driven and process-based work.

name: Yidff (Yamagata International Documentary Film Festival)
description: Biennial Japanese documentary festival renowned for politically engaged and formally experimental non-fiction cinema from Asia and beyond.
